description:
I feel I never wanted to write about my experience about fast food; however, I'll make that as an exception since the photo I posted is new to everyone.

I wanted to show how much I've been eating more vegetables.  Last Saturday at Sorabol, I ordered a veggie bibimbab.  That's right.  Everything I love to have in a rice bowl contains the following slices of prewashed colorful greens: purple lettuce, sprouts, pickled cucumbers, carrots, mushrooms, sweet pink ginger, and a couple pieces of broccoli.  Less flavorful, but healthier.  Lots of different colors from vegetables than just shades of brown chunks of meat.

I'm satisfied with the customer service, for I like how the vegetables handled well.  Barley tea is worth 92 cents, while cold water is free.
author: Jimmy C.

description:
We were on our way to the trivia finals at nearby Thomas More School when one of my friends made the suggestion to stop off at Stonestown Galleria, where there'd undoubtedly be better options that some hastily-put-together tacos and box candy.

He was right... in the most literal sense. After parking we sauntered up to Stonestown's Food Court, where the sign for Korean food caught my attention. Great, I thought... Korean food never disappoints, right?

Wrong! I ordered the Salmon Bowl with plenty of enthusiasm, but waitstaff gave no encouragement whatsoever, resorting to my favorite "nekanlain" deer-in-headlights look when they're too lazy to look up and see that there is but one person in the line... But I digress.. if that in fact were the only problem.

After waiting for nearly ten minutes (without so much as a "your order will be ready in a few, sir", I finally got my meal. Salmon itself was ok, but the noodles & rice tasted as if they'd been microwaved, and the broccoli was most certainly frozen beforehand, and not completely cooked at that - I could taste the ice! Come on people....

Yes, it's a mall shop. Expectations altered. It should at least be edible, though... next time we return I'll waste my time elsewhere.
author: Tim B.

description:
Mall food is mall food, I don't know why we expect amazing things. This is a place you eat when you are on a short lunch break, not for fulfillment. Here you can get some Korean influenced asian food, I say Korean influenced rather than Korean because it's frankly not vibrant in its flavors.

You order food, they lop it on a plate or bowl, you pay for it, then you eat. It's a little on the pricier side for mall food but it does the job. You'll feel full, you'll carry on with your day, and life goes on. So all in all, it is what it is, the food isn't terrible but it isn't wonderful either.
author: Derek T.

description: The worst experience ever in my life. The most disgusting Chicken Noodle Soup ever order. I do not wish anybody would eat such a crap at that price. To be honest the price didn't matter if it was good food. First time eating this, greatest disappointment ever. All I could do is to warn others. Hate that noddle. Chicken is burned as hell, a factor to cancer. Health issues are put on questioning, the service also sucked.
author: Bonny P.

description: OK option in the food court. It is quick and cheap and the food is OK.
author: Sunil R.

description: This was what I was chewing whilst eating takeout bbq chicken last night. A wire. Over an inch long. Today I went out of my way to show this picture to the business. The lady in charge showed my picture to the cook in the kitchen. She came out and said they didn't have a utensil that did this. Ok. I'm never going here again.
author: DJ C.

description:
The one downtown is better than this one 

Proportion is small and I feel like it cost too much 
Def can do better
author: Chiu H.

description:
Cheap, quick, Korean food.

Sorabol is food court style Asian food with a heavy focus on Korean dishes. Portion size is average, by I ended up paying $14 for ok food. The food itself was hastily slapped on my plate, mixing all the sauces and dishes into a mostly unrecognizable mess. The Korean short ribs were the highlight of the meal, but I only received a single rib. 

Too little quality for too much of a cost. You can do much better than Sorabl.
author: Nadav P.

description:
It's mall food for heavens sake! 

And to be honest, I believe it's more Japanese than Korean...despite it's name.

The chicken bowl I order was filled with sushi rice then topped with a layer of japchae and topped generously with some tender, char grilled chicken slathered in sweet teriyaki sauce, finished with just a few vegetables (broccoli and carrots). The teriyaki sauce completely covered the japchae which gave the teriyaki flavor a nutty sesame undertone...interesting, but who am I kidding - it tasted weird.

But for the price point compared to most other options at Stonestown's food court, it's not a bad deal. It more than filled me up.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
This place is a complete RIP OFF. I bought a two item plate she charged me for a short rib plate
For a scoop of rice extra $1 more
Item 2 : wonton soup with noodles
She again charged me extra for noodles that I was not informed about it. The soup base had no flavor it looked like they boiled water and added vegetables and wontons to it total rip off for $10
Than I ask her for a receipt she lied and said she gave to me where she hadn't and charged me $5 for a soda and a Snapple 
So all in all in an area where Korean food is plenty this place has the nerve to serve below standard food and overcharge customers without prior knowledge.
What a shame and a huge SCAM.
author: Zeba W.

description:
Strolled in the food court here at Stonestown today to grab some lunch....uhuh!

Not what I wanted or intended but in having just gotten off of work it was time to suck it up and get the best possible option! Sorabol is the place that I will often go aside from Greatsteak when I have to eat here.

There were a lot of folks here today around 1. It almost felt like weekend with the number of people that were here. 

When I got in line I knew exactly what I wanted, SPICY CHICKEN AND BBQ CHICKEN. This was just a no brainer!! I also got a veggie roll because what is a meal here with a roll!

After paying for the food I was on my way to the house to get to eating! 

The chicken, roll, and side of vegetables were good. Not the greatest meal but good to the point that I am now full. The portions here are very generous and that is why I stay loyal to this place. 

Good stuff all around. Plus, the ladies that work here are very friendly as well! 

#simpleandfilling
author: Robert F.

description: Interesting how this place closed.  I had been eating here every Tuesday and had a stomach ache for 3 weeks straight before closure.   Stopping coming here solved my stomach problems.
author: Bjj P.

description: Despite its location in a mall food court, I had hoped it would be a decent, serviceable meal but I was wrong... so lets start with what was good.  The ladies working the counter were nice enough and the white rice was fine.  The Snapple tasted like Snapple but that's is it.   Maybe I should have stuck with the bibimbap but I was feeling hopeful.    The so-called kimchee stew was a lot of tofu and shredded cabbage in a bowl of siricha flavored water.   The salmon bowl had a slab of salmon skin sitting atop a bowl of sugary soy stewed rice noodles with a bizarre after taste, finished with two pieces of cold broccoli.  The last dish we had was a spicy tofu that had the exact same bizarre tasting noodles....sorry, this stuff is just terrible.
author: Steinbeck H.

description: I had the veggie bowl (bibimbap) for lunch. Not sure if they're trying to suck or don't care but as the other reviews will tell you it's pretty gross. Borderline inedible. The veggies were cold/ not seasoned. The tofu was weird and overall didn't fit in with the cold bland veggies. Had to toss it. Go elsewhere.
author: Alex F.

description: It is my first visit to Sarabol. NOT IMPRESSED!. The chicken was mostly skin, soggy noddles, the rest was ok. Don't know if I want to go again next time. Suit yourself.
author: Viktor K.

description: This place has horrible service I asked for shrimp soup like 4 times and I end up getting just a box with noddle and shrimp on top I told them that wasn't what I ask for and they refuse to give my shrimp soup  no coming back to this place !
author: Nidia A.

description: $.50 more for fried rice that's not cooked properly and workers don't tell you that they charge more for quite a small portion of rice. Food is over cooked, pricey for what they serve you, will never buy food from here again. Watch out for hidden fees!
author: Lyn B.

description: Just ordered the chicken lunch plate. Egg roll had a frozen center. Veggies were also served ICE cold. Told front counter cashier and she said she told me she would tell the kitchen. No refund offered. Bad service with bad food.
author: Ken L.

description: Stop by for lunch, order half noodle half brown rice for  two items bowl, charged additional $.50 for small portion of brown rice without any noticed, till checkout station. Whole bowl portion size is 1/3 less than before, but charged more than $10, it is soooo pricey. Service not nice, definitely won't come back and recommended
author: Selena G.

description: This place don't deserve any stars from me..is was 1/2 hour to closing time.. The old lady toke my order.. I told her I wanted rice n clear noodles n curry with beef short ribs..she had a nerve to tell me !! Oh short ribs very expensive  !! I was like how $$$$ ??? I want a combo with 2 items ??!!!  I have money to buy.. So I said ok.. She starts copping into a bowl.. I was like a bowl ??? Not on a plate ??? N she rang it up n bought a coke too... Came out to be $18.00+ !!!!!! Like did she jus made it up how much to charge ??? I had ate at this chain at other locations.. I never been charge this price before... N it was serve on a plate.. N curry onto a Separate bowl...damn wonder when this booth close ???
author: Crisy G.

description: This is my first time to try this food. I ordered noodles with BBQ chicken and tofu and Thai tea. Only one thing can eat is tofu. The noodles is SUPER salty that I can't eat. Otherwise Thai tea is no sugar. The most ridiculous thing is when you ask or talk to the employees, they only use the finger to point out what I want to do. They don't even want to explain to me. They are quite unfriendly. I will not come back again.
author: Boo L.

description:
I should have known better to expect anything more than decent from a food court Korean restaurant, but I was so hungry, and Korean food sounded so good. But alas, I did this to myself.

Lunch "pick 2" special. Comes with rice (for brown rice it's $0.50 extra) some broccoli greens, and japchae (sweet potato glass noodles). For my two main dishes, I got the spicy chicken and the spicy pork for a little over $10.

-The chicken had chunks of cartilage
-The pork had the texture of a processed, soft chicken nugget but mushier 
-The japchae was bland
-The brown rice was watery
-The broccoli were fine, but were sparse

Needless to say, I will not be coming back. Less than average customer service as well. No smiles. :/
author: Cara O.

description: Sorabol added a new soft tofu stew on their menu. It pales in comparison to what you would get at an authentic Korean restaurant.  It had a lot of sliced cabbage, soft tofu with cubes of beef in it and some slivers of carrots, slices of mushrooms.  You can order mild or spicy and the mild is a bit too spicy for me as is.  They are generous with the rice, in a paper container same as what Hot Dog on a Stick serves their corn dogs in.  The container is filled with rice which I couldn't finish.  The flavor of the broth isn't very good and isn't worth finishing.  I wouldn't order this dish again, $9.  If you must eat at Sorabol, better to stick with their chicken/beef bowls and entree platters.  They don't seem to do the soup dishes right.
author: Ry T.

description: I got the veggie bowl/bibimbap and it tasted good but was pretty small on the portion size. The food was good but I think for the price (about $9) i would rather get something else; Nice service.
author: C. L.

description:
Sorabol = sore bowel 

Terrible terrible food.  Avoid. 

It is not even that cheap anymore.
author: Jasper D.

description: Expectations! Mall food! This is the 2nd food in the mall. #1 in the Philly steak place. It's a close second between the hot dog on a stick place and the Korean stall. The Korean place wins because their service is super friendly and the food is nice. I don't eat rice or noodles and the ladies have never questioned the fact. They seem perfectly happy to load my plate with pickled veg. I get a huge plate of chicken with every type of vegetable imaginable. I love the cucumber and the daikon! It's in a mall so I expect mall food. The ladies are awesome!!!
author: Corey Jace W.

description:
There's a big daddy Sorabol at Westfield Centre.  Once you've had him you keep searching for him in every future Sorabol relationship.  

There's a red-headed bastard step-child of big daddy at Metreon which makes you question whether the two are even related.  Ain't no DNA test ever proved it.   

Then there's a young buck, obviously big daddy related, at Stonestown.  Yes, I had to remember to request free kimchi because they're hiding it out of sight (for what purpose?) but my usual chicken bowl was fine: an ample amount of chicken, noodles, vegetables, and rice and it all tasted good.  The counter staff asked if, rather than assumed, I wanted sauce on top.  They were responsive to my water request, even for the second cupful. 

It's difficult for future generations to live up to their successful parents.  This Sorabol won't ever rival big daddy but he's honoring him with the same menu and respectable execution of a food court chicken bowl.
author: Tracey A.

description:
I wanted to get a meat and vegetable combo so I substituted everything other than the meat with vegetables. The cashier lady tacked on another $3 for the substitutions so the total came out to be $13 with tax. Panda express does the substitutions for no extra charge. For the price and taste it was absolutely not worth it. 

Not going back again.
author: Charlie R.

description: This place have delicious chicken and kalbi. Price is reasonable good food friendly staff. Better than downtown location. Definitely worth it.
author: Yoki P.

description: Freaking worst service ever, especially the short hair women, so rude. I made a mistake of ordering the meal then I tried to be nice and smile with her but she throw the bowl and shout that why dont i tell her (this is unacceptable behavior) because she didnt ask me that what I need first and I dont know exactly what they serve by the way. Food is not good in here too.  Actually the Sorabol in Westfield is way better. If i can give half of star, i would give that women (not really for the food). I got a right decision that i leave right away after she throw the bowl. I have to say sorry for Sorabol that you hired a woman like that to work for you.
author: Nany P.

description: There is really no way to put this. I am not talking about the food, Sorabol taste the same everywhere as far as my experience goes. This place has the same taste in food but they charge ridiculous amount of money for smaller portion of food. The communication is also confusing as they don't really understand most of the time what I'm trying to get. In the end, I still prefer not eating there if I have a choice.
author: Kevin H.

description:
2 hungry people with no idea where to eat. Something not $$$ and something FAST, we only had an hour of lunch. We drove to Stones and this is where we ended up at.

Friend had BBQ chicken, I think there were too many cancerous parts for that but other than that, she seemed to enjoy it.

My beef bulgogi was delicious and only $8 http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=CAveDmi9tYg3Gbs9VVnm2Q&select=DhkVeSRap327Vh-LNdhaMw. I thought I wouldn't get much food or would be full but I was wrong, my bowl had a lot of food in it.

Meat, japchae, rice, & veggies for less than $10 each, good deal.

I will definitely be back for more.
author: Kylie L.

description: I was double charged for my meal and was told it only went through once. I checked my statement and was indeed charged twice for my meal. I wasn't given a refund on my meal. Not happy
author: Carlene S.

description:
Made the mistake of coming  here because I wanted something else other than Panda Express, Tokyo express, and even mcdonalds all because I "needed something knew"

Their portions are so tiny it barely filled half the bowl... Like really? For $8+ I sucked up the food and was pretty unsatisfied. I know we Asians are stingy with portions just to make a profit but seriously? Not coming here again, plenty of other better options in the food court.
author: Harriet W.

description:
There's really no way to butcher their bibimbap, so if you're on the fence, undecided or skeptical, go for it. It's like orange chicken at Panda Express. You're not really sure what to get but you have another side waiting to be picked -you get it by default. 

This isn't to say that the food here is bad. In fact, it's pretty good. But the service here? Kinda sucks. The only good customer service they have going for them is the 2 teenage girls who take cash and the Mexican cooks who take the time to look up and smile. The older ladies who work here, they're pretty rude too. Brush their attitudes aside tho because the rice bowls are pretty darn good.

BONUS: If you do get the rice bowl or bibimbap, ask for it to-go. Their containers are nice enough to reuse for to-go lunches.
author: Shilo B.

description: overpriced Korean food here! Though the menu states each bowl and its meat, you still have to add a dollar for the meat! And each bowl states it comes with noodles, but the lady told me you have to pay extra! Unbelievable!
author: Mary ..

description:
I'm allergic to horrible service; the employees are extremely rude here. The portions shrunk over the years, and the quality has gone down as well. Food doesn't taste fresh. I used to have leftovers from my veggie bibimbap or chicken bowl, but now I can finish an order and still feel hungry.

The Sorabol at Westfield Mall in downtown SF is better, but I still suggest going to a real sit-down Korean restaurant in the Richmond district instead of getting this stuff.
author: Priscilla W.

description: Terrible, especially when you compare it to the Sorabol in the Westfield Shopping Mall downtown. Last time we came here they ran out of almost everything and their japchae tasted limp. There was also no veggies (e.g., carrots, mushrooms, cabbage) in the japchae. You'd think different branches would at least share recipes. It was weird, I don't anticipate ever coming back here again.
author: Tiffany H.

description: Came here with my business partners after a long day of work for a quick bite to eat, paid over 50 bucks for 4 dishes and 4 drinks, complete rip off if you ask me.  Should of know better
author: Aaron E.

description:
I used to like this place a lot when I was in high school. I love their clear noodles and the beef except for the fat hanging off it. 

Anyway, since I was starving and at stones I decided sure why not. I go up and this angry looking spider eyed Korean lady entices me with some chicken. I'm like sure why not. I order a plate of beef. They totally skimp here! The one at Westfield center gives you twice as much food for the same price! WTF! 

I also got a thai ice tea. It was gross.  

The food was not bad but kind of cold. Won't be coming back!
author: Sarah C.

description:
Stonestown has one of the few mall food courts that features Korean, Chinese, and Japanese fast food. Most other places only have 2 out of 3.

My experience at this Korean fast food location is tampered by somewhat rude service. I think that spooks customers, so most end up at Panda Express or Teriyaki Express. The food is not bad but not great either.

2.5 stars overall, because they are not as generous with portions as the main Rincon Center location.
author: Luis C.

description:
Place is overpriced and pretty awful

I guess you can blame it on the fact that it's located in the mall or you could blame it on the fact that any food place at the mall sucks. Either way, this is horrible. It's super expensive and the portions suck. You can just taste the fakeness of the food and the microwave that cooked it. I just don't understand how there is a line for this place sometimes. 

All in all don't come here please
author: Javier G.

description:
Your expectations shouldn't be high, especially since you're eating at a food court. I've had the good fortune of eating at many Korean places, so I had a hankering for some recently. Did I walk in hoping to find the gem that everyone was wrong about? No. Did I at a minimum just want some BBQ short ribs that fulfilled my desire for some Korean food? Yes. And the Outcome? Met expectations. 

The people working here actually seemed to be Korean, which is refreshing considering everything in San Francisco that is ethnic Asian is really just Chinese people in facade. The short ribs weren't bad, the service was a decent and speedy. It was a bit pricey.
author: Phan H.

description: This place has been steadily going downhill especially over the last couple of years. I don't know if they have sold it to new operators, but the food is not the same. When they start nickle and diming you for things like counting the grains of rice or counting out the vegetables, then it's time to find another place. Portions get smaller and smaller each time. Our meal this evening will be our last time visiting this food court stand. Food was bland and tasteless and left us totally unsatisfied and yearning for something else to satiate out taste buds. Spend your hard earned money elsewhere.
author: Will L.

description: This review is for just one of their dishes which I indulge in every now and then: the vegetarian curry. It's got a pleasant level of heat and great balance of spices. To make it an authentic Korean experience, be sure to get it with a 50/50 mix of steamed rice and bean thread noodles (depending on the server, they may try to skimp on the noodles- keep an eye out).
author: Gene G.

description: MEH! I don't normally review food court food, but I was so disappointed in the portions that this particular Sorabol gave, I knew I just had to review them. After eating at the Westfield location and being amazed with how big their portions were, I went to Sorabol the next day and ordered the same thing. Yes, it was cheaper, but it was about half the size of what they gave me at the Westfield location! Also, the food didn't taste or look fresh, and I visited at 10AM. The employees scooped the portions as if they were trying to feed a million people with the food that they had. Ugh skip!
author: Joyce E.

description:
I'm not a total fan of this place, but when I'm starving during lunch break and the only comfort I get is speaking to the ajumas and ajushis who work there; this place does its justice. I usually get this surprised look on their face when I order in Korean. They give you extra kimchi and meat when you speak their language. lol

I usually order the chicken bbq to go, hold the salad and gimme more kimchi! Japchae is mediocre, could be better. Ah well...being a mall worker ain't easy either.
author: Jason C. J.

description: Order sofu soup with seafood. The cashier told me the seafood is shrimp. But I only got three shrimps, one mussel and some fake seafood. The soup taste like they just add spice into water. And that's how they call it "soup". Even Panda Express is better than it.
author: Fangfang O.

description:
What happened?! This particular Sorabol used to pack it on but now they skimp. The portion has dwindled down and it's no longer worth the $7-9 dollars you'll be spending on a meal. Their food is still great! But i left unhappy with what I was given. I don't normally review food court stops but Christmas shopping leaves me famished and Sorabol was a regrettable decision. I used to be able to share a bowl or plate with one other person. I think one plate will barely cover one meal for a single person now. 

Disappointed. Go to the Tanforan Sorabol.. they still give you a lot of food!

Stonestown Sorabol - Bring back decent sized portions and stop being cheap!!
author: Samantha L.

description:
Ate here on Black Friday.  I have to agree with many of the other Yelpers. The food has plummeted. Portion size is minuscule compared to the Sorabol location at the Westfield food court.

Most times I order the spicy pork rice bowl when I eat here.  However, today, the spicy pork tasted like cornstarch, the rice was below average, and they stopped topping the dish with broccoli and substituted raw shredded cabbage on top.  The yam noodles had some redeeming quality. Even the rice bowl container seemed reduced in size.

My husband usually orders the bbq chicken.  Well, portion size was also small.  I don't like to get the bbq chicken because it always seem burnt and dry, even for thigh meat.

What happened to this place?  It really has gone downhill from its heyday when it first appeared here at the Stonestown food court.

Yuck, yuck, and yuck.
author: Shirley N.

description:
Been coming here once in a while for almost two years now. Still the same two ladies who look like they hate their jobs and resent having to take orders working the line. So comforting to have stability in a chaotic world. 

Honestly it's pretty overpriced for what you get, but the area around SFSU is a Mad Max wasteland when it comes to food, so I'll shell out for a tasty BBQ Pork bowl once in a while. I think they used to have a teriyaki chicken bowl lunch special that was $6, not sure if they still do that. Otherwise a bowl is like $8-something after tax. 

Could trim the meat a bit better in general. Still one of the better options in a mega food ghetto, though.
author: Jeremy H.

description: The best place I've had the chance to eat lately, I live nearby and I never noticed this place , their chicken is the best, and the people are really nice. The food is almost like is my country.  I am actually shoked by the  bad reviews they have. Haters go eat to your stupid panda and other shit. Awesome place
author: Mihail G.

description: One of the first things I crave when I come back to the Bay is Sorabol's veggie bowl.  I go to the mall not to shop, but to dine. Sticky rice topped with an assortment of pickled veggies, noodles, BBQ chicken, and teriyaki sauce does a body good.
author: Justine D.

description:
This Korean restaurant is in Stonestown food court. The mall is usually busy in the food court so don't be surprised if you have to wait to order or for your food to be ready.
The food here is good enough for a quick bite. There's nothing special about the food here. I usually only get it if I'm craving it, or if I'm feeling sickish. If I'm feeling sickish, I get the soup. The only thing on the menu that I really like is the vermicelli. Other than that, the food is pretty plain. Not too much flavor in any of the food. You'd think that with the amount of time they make you wait after you order, they'd make it good.
The Thai Iced Tea is actually hot tea that they pour over ice. So it's always diluted. I've had it there several times and it's like the rest of their food, nothing above good.
If you're craving cheap Korean food and you're near SFSU, this is the place to go.
author: Chris L.

description:
wow. used to love this place so much. great meal to pick up and eat at home. 

but last night ordered the spicy pork bowl times 2 - some for dinner - some for lunch the next day. and some eggrolls (overly greasy).

WHAT??? so sticky, so overly sweet. but i was hungry and made the mistake of eating it. SICK ALL NIGHT. 

do you think they will let me return the one i didn't eat? the one i don't dare eat??
author: rob s.

description:
"Snip... snip... snip..."
That's the sound of the food you're SUPPOSED to get on your plate going back into the metal tubs under the heat lamps.

Skimpy like a Brazilian bikini. I've had my share of Sorabol food from Westfield and at Sunvalley Mall back in the East Bay, and this is seriously the worst Sorabol I've ever had. Not only are the portions totally inadequate for the price, the people behind the counter are rude and off-putting. I asked for a pair of chopsticks when I got to the cashier and was told to hold on (which is fine) and then not a few seconds later he plops my food down on a tray with a plastic fork then gives me this "scram" look and motions for the next person to be rung up. Uh... okay.

Meat and rice tasted okay even though there wasn't very much and the meat was chewy like it had been in the tub for a while, which was probably true. However, the steamed veggies (broccoli and two carrot slices) were COLD. Like they just took it out of the fridge cold. How weird.

All in all, not coming back here again.
author: Tiffany C.

description: Not bad for mall food but the Korean BBQ joint that's in the Westfield mall sf is better. I can't believe they don't have spicy BBQ chicken! But like I said it ain't that bad.
author: Carlos G.

description:
Oh sorabol, you never fail to disappoint. I remember coming here when they first opened, they were superb! Big portions for a reasonable price. And it semi-fixed my Korean cravings. 

For the past few years they've gotten SOOO darn stingy! I mean really now. I understand you don't wanna lose money by giving too big portions but it's just ridiculous now. 

The food is decent, but the price and poor service just makes it not worth it.

Plus, I got some weird smelling kimchi. Blegh!
author: Bianca W.

description:
I've eaten here..it's okay.   This chain is not bad, for korean in a quick pinch.  (Especially when you've been shopping for a few hours.)  But I'd rather go to a real restaurant for the bulgogi, soups, etc.  Plus, something to be said about having the overall atmosphere effect at a Korean restaurant/joint.

Price-wise, for a quick helping of Korean food, for under $8 for a bowl of rice with japchae, meat and/or tofu and veggies, it's not too bad.   Their potstickers leave you wanting for better stuff elsewhere.  Egg rolls look like they've been fried at least thrice... 

It's at the Stonestown food court, folks...so don't expect good service.  Maybe quick in-and-out at the lines, should they choose to be on a good day.
author: Fannie S.

description:
Paid $8.25 for a beef bowl. It was disgusting and very dry!! I also ordered Chicken BBQ. Apparently, the rice and noodle portion was so little. When you cut up the chicken, I'm like watching you and in my head thinking... YOU BETTER PICK UP ANOTHER PIECE!!!  

Not worth it. Capitola Sorabol is much much better.
author: Alyssa S.

description: I really love the noodles here,  which have the weirdest consistancey but are so good! the rice and chicken are really good as well so I would.reccommend it!
author: Adina V.

description:
Please don't expect superior customer service here. Especially if you're at the mall's food court.

Do expect reasonable prices for the food you're getting. 

I had a lunch plate of pan-fried mackerel, rice, Korean style noodles (similar to the Filipino's version of pansit)  and steamed veggies.

My food was passable.  Their steamed veggies were cold. It was a little bit of a surprise for me when I first bit into it.

But, for the price of seven dollars and some change, and a healthier version of fast food, you can't beat that.

Even at a mall food court.
author: Janice C.

description:
I haven't been here in such a long time, years even since I've boycotted Sorabol due to the horrible service they gave me and a friend.  

I came to this spot and my friend actually ordered and paid for food for the both of us, which I do have to say is decent mall Korean food, but what happened at the register was just rude and unacceptable service.  

After I told my friend what I wanted from Sorabol, I went to another food establishment two spots down from Sorabol to get another item to go with the food I got from this Sorabol.  When I came back with a tray from the other restaurant and as my friend was paying, I had told my friend that I needed napkins.  So, he asks the lady at the register for napkins.  She gives him ONE paper thin napkin.  He asks her if he can have a couple more sheets since there were two of us.  She says pointing at me, "no, she can get napkins from the place she got her food from." I proceed to say, "actually he just paid for my food that is on that tray, so technically I did get food from here too."  She just continues to tell me to get my napkins at the other restaurant.  Then, my friend says that the one napkin wouldn't even be enough for him because it's really thin. But, of course she didn't budge and said we could not get anymore napkins.  

I was livid that I told her that I didn't want my food that he just literally just paid for and obviously didn't touch, but she said we couldn't get our money back.  WTH!  We paid for food, but because ALL of our food isn't from your restaurant you want us to get necessary items to eat from another establishment.  Talk about stingy and unacceptable customer service!!!!!!!  So, since we couldn't get more napkins, we took about 4 more pieces of plastic forks & knives that was set in front of her for customers to take.  Hmmm....what's more expensive more plastic or a couple more pieces of paper thin napkins? I know childish thing to do, but we wanted to make a point. Maybe use it as a trade tactic....we'll put back the forks if you give us napkins? LOL. 

It's been years since I've eaten at any Sorabol because it doesn't deserve a penny from me.  So now when I never want to come back to an establishment, I say I want to "Sorabol it" meaning the service sucks and they're never getting money from me again.
author: Caroline A.

description:
STINGY.  

I normally go to the Sorabol in Westfield mall but needed to run some errands at Stonestown Mall.  I got hungry and ended up ordering the Short ribs entree for take out instead of dine-in (the location is at a food court).  They gave me a small container with 2 (TWO!!!) ribs and noodles.  I was charged the SAME FULL PRICE as the one at Westfield Mall, which I believe was something like $11 or $12.  I felt cheated that I only got half of what I paid for. Don't go here.  The meat was old and tough.  Gross.

Go to the Sorabol at Westfield mall instead.  They are generous with their portions and the food tastes WAAAAAAAYYYY better!
author: Allie C.

description: The food was good for mall food but my order took forever. I got the Won Ton Soup and by the time mine came out, my boyfriend was almost finished with his.
author: Alexandra W.

description:
In the world of mall foods this place is a 4 out of 5 which means when I'm in Stonestown or at the office (near Stonestown) it's one of a handful of default places to go because they're consistent, service is quick, and the food is decent (for mall food). 

I've never seen the employees smile but I've also never seen them be rude either, instead it's just this middle ground where they get the order right quickly, cut the pieces to bite size with scissors eliminating the need for a knife, and instead they give me a fork but chopsticks are available upon request. Though now that I think about it, they actually will bring me my spicy noodles to my table when it's not to busy which is an outstanding bit of courtesy when it comes to mall service.

The food is pre-made and sits in steam trays up front but the kitchen with the cooks are visible so the lessens the fear of it coming from frozen, just more aware that it's cooked in bulk but once again, this is mall food.

Portions are decent, I'm able to finish my meals without feeling stuffed or still hungry but I do wish they added more veggies rather than the standard couple piece of broccoli and a carrot wedge.

Like I said, it's not great food but it's one of the better spots at Stonestown.
author: Keith A.

description:
I frequently come here to get my KBBQ fix when I'm in the mall. I rarely go anywhere else except, well.. Starbucks.

I've been coming here quite often since I also went to school nearby, so I've noticed: 1) prices going up 2) portions getting smaller and 3) same workers in the front.

Sure, the workers don't seem as friendly, but they're actually all pretty nice. 
I think they remember my order too... BBQ Chicken bowl with a little bit of sauce. Sometimes I'll order a Thai Iced Tea or Thai Iced Coffee. Yum. I'm getting hungry... But anyway. 
The portion sizes are kind of skimpy now, so you'll eat enough to make you feel.. content. Is it worth the money? I don't really know... All I know is, when I want to eat something, I'll eat it. HAHAHA.
author: Susan Y.

description:
Food : So..so
Price : Not worth it at all
the People behind the counter : super rude 
Never  ever want to go back.
author: Xinta B.

description:
the two lady workers are so rude! one takes the orders while the other collects payment. i ordered the kimchi tofu soup with lady#1; you have the option of getting it with meat or seafood. i wanted neither so i requested no beef - she gave me the death glare and i felt her telepathy yelling 'are you effing kidding me?"  when asked whether i would get some assorted veggies in lieu of the beef she snapped "you'll get no beef" (okay.....)

i was quickly shooed down to the register to pay with lady#2. i tried once again to reiterate my question to see  whether i could get some assorted veggies to ensure my meal would have a little more substance than soup. while i was addressing lady#2, lady#1 comes out of NO WHERE, starts wailing her tongs at me, and interjects with " YOU'LL GET NO BEEF WITH KIMCHI!" 

so i ended up with a dismal soup with just kimchee & tofu, charged the same price as the beef soup without actually getting any beef or protein. and there i sat in the saddest of food courts, drinking the saddest of korean soups feeling a lot like charlie from willy wonka whose family had nothing to drink but cabbage soup.
author: Annie L.

description: Ordered the short ribs from this place for lunch yesterday. It was okay. Kinda cold. My fave is still Hi Seoul in Newpark Mall because they cook the short ribs when you order it so it is hot & yummy. :)
author: Amy C.

description:
I go here to get some food since there is no dinner at home. Fat Chinese looking wannabe Korean at the counter takes my order for a beef and chicken bowl to go. I noticed that I'm the only one there and the Chicken stash is stacked high as f*ck. I guess dinner will be filling. Guy busts out 2 plastic cartons and the fun begins.... :(

Fat f*ck gives only 1 measly grab of tong for beef. Thinking I'm stupid, greedy CHEAP bastard keeps on cutting the single grab of beef just to TRY to make it look more. Seriously, with that much cutting, you ain't making more meat unless you giving me another grab of beef with the tongs.

As for the chicken plate it gets PATHETIC. The Westfield mall location gives a sh*tload of food without addition requests. Fat greedy CHEAP wannabe Korean bastard with glasses gives me ONLY 1 piece of chicken and does the fake slice n dice to try to multiple the meat. Seriously did this idiot ever take multiplications in elementary school? The chicken plate looks like a f*cking 3 year old's dinner. 

Worse of all is the douchebag cashier, I'm guessing the OWNER who does the WORST fake smile while taking your money. Seriously you'd want to punch out this monkey if you have a chance. Thus my conclusion....

AVOID UNDER ANY POSSIBLE CIRCUMSTANCES! Even a Grande Starbucks coffee fills you up more than the food here. The worst Chinese wannabe Korean CHEAP FAT BASTARDS I've ever seen running a Korean food joint.

RUN do not walk to the Westfield location for Korean fast food. This location probably changed owners AGAIN, thus the crap food and service. 

As for the minuscule amount of food the reviewers have been complaining about, I SWEAR that the FAT Chinese wannabe Korean guy is skimping on your orders and eating your portion in the back. Thus you wonder how he got SO FAT! I bet if you BBQ that guy and gut him open, you'll all find your orders inside.
author: Joseph N.

description:
I don't recommend this place at all. In comparasion to the Sorabol in Westfield, the Stonestown Sorabol is CHEAP and BLAND!

- Their servers forgot parts of the meal! Seriously?! Not to mention the main parts of the meal!

- They substituted ingredients such as beef, leek, etc. They had stripes of carrots which is abnormal for the meal.

- The buffet selection is probably leftovers from last night or maybe even a week. It tasted a bit...stale?

I expected better and was deeply disappointed. I hope that the people in charge of Sorabol will fix the place soon.
author: Jannet H.

description:
I'm a frequent diner at the Westfield location. We were shopping here on Sunday and decided to get some food and eat at home. Looking at their slim pickings I pointed out 2 things that were good. The lady working here was actually friendly. I ordered the 2 short rib item combo. Yes I know it's short rib and one other item. But I only wanted short rib. I watch as she grabs one strip of short rib, cut it between the bones, grab the 2nd short rib, cut between the bone, then grab the 3rd strip of short ribs then cut between the bones. Um.....shouldn't I get 4 strips of short ribs cuz I got the 2 item combo? I mean if I got just the one item short rib combo, I'd get 2 strips of short rib right? 

I also got a tiny scoop of rice and a tiny scoop of noodles and veggies.

I will never eat at this location again and stick with the Westfield location. Westfield gives me a TON of food. Yes it's rea;;y true that they give you enough food to feed 2 people. This location puts the company name to shame!

TERRIBLE!!! Ive been here a few times because I thought it was a bad day the first or second time so I gave them a few chances.

Heres whats wrong:

1. Service is the worse EVER. The workers seem to hate their jobs- they are so rude!
2. Stingy!! They put the smallest amount of food on the plate. You ask for more of something or a side of sauce and they give you the weirdest look and give you the smallest amount. I have seriously asked for a some soy sauce (for an order of 3) and they handed me one small pack!
3. They are EXPENSIVE. So not worth it.
4.The food is whatever- 2 out of 5 starts

The people are RUDE, STINGY, and the food is such a SMALL amount and not even that great. DO NOT BUY FROM THEM.
author: Jessie A.

description:
I think this is actually one of the better "Lowell Lunch" options.

If you get the vermicelli that already has protein in it and the chicken bowl isin't too pricey and tastes pretty good.

And they're acceptably fast. If there's no line you can make it there and back in a mod. Just walk fast.
author: Elena C.

description: I've eaten here twice, and they've both been rather forgettable experiences.  I think I keep hoping for a repeat of a Sorabol that I've eaten at elsewhere (Rincon, SF mall), but no, it's a different chain, and the food quality (as well as quantity) is worse.  Most recently, I had the noodle salad w/ beef, and it was a mess.  The beef tasted like it came from a can, the noodles were dry and bland, and I only ate it for the vegetables.  I should try the other food court options.  Or, I should just stop eating at food courts.  :D
author: Gerald C.

description: Yummy stir-fry noodles. I like this place but the one in Bloomingdales concourse food court  in downtown is better. You can tell the difference. The service kind of sucks too but it's bearable. The cashier looks like he doesn't do anything until there's customers to ring up. The other half of the time, he's taking up space in the food court where customers can sit just so he can read his newspaper....
author: Jessica R.

description: Not bad for mall food.  I had the clear noodles with spicy beef. The girl behind the counter was nice. She let me try a few items.  I asked for extra bowls the price was reasonable.  I can't wait to try the spicy ramen next time.
author: Allen C.

description: Every time I'm at the Westfield Mall downtown, I usually eat at Sorabol. Not a big fan of the food court at Stonestown and the only options I was thinking was Sorabol and Panda. First of all, they didn't give me my money's worth. I mean downtown, they give you hella to the point it could be for lunch and dinner. This place they really don't give you any noodles or meat and I got the combo where you pick 2 things. Next time I'll just go to Bart Grocery where they give you hella food and it's worth your money. Oh and I like how the guy didn't even give a receipt, smh.
author: Janice V.

description:
located at Stonestown food court.  Pleasant food court in revitalized shopping mall.  

I asked if they could put my short ribs on soup noodles.  Instead, they put them on a bed of bean thread vermicelli noodles - and it was fabulous!  They threw in some steamed veggies so I wouldn't have just meat and carbs.  Tasty!  Off the menu.  Kinda expensive - $9 for mall food court food, but still yummy.
author: Doctor G.

description:
This is sad.

I got my Korean cherry popped here.

How so? This is where I had kim chee for the very first time.

Sad, isn't it?

The food here is eh, mediocre. Just another food joint in a mall.
author: Nance W.

description:
I eat at Sorabol A LOT!  It's a great choice because not only is it delicious, but pretty inexpensive too.  You can't go wrong with a big plate of meat, broccoli and noodles for around $7.00.  

I haven't been to this location yet but will be trying it soon!
author: Lauren C.

description:
Surprisingly good for Asian mall food. I ordered the spicy pork, and they gave good portions, and it came with vegetables and noodles on the side. The lady who took my order was really nice too.

My friend I went with said the Sorabol in Westfield is a lot better. So I'm going to have to try that out.
author: Xavier G.

description: This place has surely gone down hill they used to give you 10 broccoli's now they give you 2, 2 tiny ones and they only give you 1 tiny carrot. Plus they don't give you that much chicken or rice this place is a sinking ship I'm not coming back ever.
author: Aurelio L.

description: Sorabol can get pretty expensive when you eat here for lunch everyday. I always get the beef bowl; it works for me.
author: Forest S.

description:
Chicken bowl ok for quickie.
Thai ice tea sucks!!!

Mall food!!  What do you expect!!
author: Ray Y.

description:
Im not a big fan of this place...but my lady is.

But then again she only orders the clear noodle and chicken each time she eats here..so I dont think shes in love with this place either.

The staff here needs to lighten up a bit and there was this guy that was cutting the chicken...he needs to smile more..maybe that will brighten his day. But then again if I was working there I would probably have that face too.

The chicken is ALRIGHT..and the veggies are kind of hard..the noodles are good...Ive never had the rice there before.
author: phillip w.

description:
If you need a Korean fix, you are in the right place, but I tell you, Geary Street ain't that far, now is it.

And  yes, I dig that they cut up my foodies with scissors! SCISSORS! I'm sure this is not a purely Korean thing (what do I know I'm Filipino), but I'm weird like that. BBQ plates are huge and you better be hungry, but if you're medium hungry a bowl will be just fine.

It ain't Korean enough if your clothes don't smell like it when you're done, baby. And you'll be more mallified than Koreanified.
author: Charlene L.

description:
If you are used to visiting the Sorabol at the Westfield San Francisco Center food court, you will be majorly disappointed when you come to this location.  

The downtown Sorabol dishes out heaping plates of barbeque, rice, noodles and broccoli that would satisfy two of more people per portion.  It would be fair to describe it as Texas-sized fast food Korean barbeque.

The Stonestown Sorabol reminds me of the communion "snack" (read: communication wafer) at church ... teeny-tiny, but just enough to make you hungry for a real meal.  Go ahead and order something if you're heading over to a movie and will be snacking on popcorn anyway or if you're not too hungry.

How does it taste?  Like fast food with a side of kimchi and the burps.
How much does it cost?  It costs as much as a "value meal" of any sort at a burger joint. Eh .. about as much as you would expect to pay for fast food.

One thing to be wary of ... they REALLY should work on their customer service skills.  Girlfriends ain't friendly and never say thanks!!

P.S.  I forgot to mention that they CHARGE you for hot sauce.  What the ...?!!
author: Jenny K.

description: I used to like coming here to fulfill my craving for Korean short ribs. However, today I discovered that Ono's Hawaiian BBQ at Lakeshore Plaza serves better tasting ones (or, at least in my opinion, it is), and their plate is around $2 less. That's likely now be my place of choice now for Korean short ribs. At least here they may still have some spicy soup noodle items that I may wish to go for occasionally.
author: H K.

description:
I just finished eating my leftover spicy pork/spicy chicken bowl from Sorabol and decided to write a review about it. Honestly, I'm quite surprised at the low overall rating for this place!

At Sorabol, you have your choice of the bowls, combination plates, our soup noodles. I always go for the bowls here. They run for about $7 and consist of steamed rice, chop chae (vermicelli noodles), your choice of meat, and a few pieces of broccoli. My only beef (no pun intended) with this place is that they are generous with the meat servings but stingy as heck with the veggies! And the broccoli is hard, cold and flavorless...so obviously they don't specialize in that. 

For a food-court joint, I think this place is actually really good! The price is pretty reasonable...nothing comes cheap anymore in this slumping economy. It's not authentic Korean food...but it is good for what it is. If you do like this place, then try it at the food court in the new SF Shopping Center...it's even better there!
author: Allan M.

description:
Hmmm...should I just stop somewhere in West Portal to eat? Nah, I'll just eat at Stonerstown and deal with my shopping all in one shot. Ooh...curry bowl!

D'oh!
author: Maximillian M.

description:
This place is surprisingly amazing!

A few days ago, I walked by and took note that they take credit cards.  That's a big deal for a Mall Food Court Restaurant, in my book.  So I made note of that and decided that I'd try it out in the future.
Last Sunday, I walked up and ordered some food and headed over to the register.  When I got there, I saw that the credit card sign was replaced with a Cash Only sign.  (OH NO!)
For a second, I thought I was going crazy and I told the lady that I thought I was going to be able to pay with my credit card and that I had no cash with me.

To my shock, the lady said "Oh, that's okay. Write your name down and you can pay me next time."

I could not believe this.  I was so socked I didn't know what to say.  She then explained that her credit card machine had gotten wet and it wasn't my fault that I couldn't pay her and I had to eat! LOL

Yes, I went back and paid my tab and I'm getting used the kim chee too. ;)
author: Max K.

description: It's fine, ok, just average, same for Sorabol Westfield. I just eeny-meeny places to eat when at Stonestown. The Chicken Barbeque is my only fave. Good thing the owner was the one who took my order and I got a good serving :)
author: Pierre B.

description: Was at Stonestown over the weekend and just...couldn't...help...coming here again. I thought that maybe things (read: portion sizes) may have changed. Wouldn't have believed that portion sizes could be worse but sadly and astonishingly, they were. It's like they discovered what the correct portion size for carbs should be (your fist) and decided to reduce that by half. C'mon people, you serve Asian food and that usually means more than half a fist of rice. Server and cashier were not friendly and obviously didn't get the "10 Ways to Great Customer Service" handbook. Place was so apathetic, it made me wonder if they wanted to get closed down by Corporate Sorabol, if such an entity exists. So sorry to see a once-great Korean fast food place sink to such depths.
author: Lulu H.

description: Quick and clean korean fast food that's different from many other places offered in the Stonestown mall!  It more of an alternative to Panda Express and Tokyo Express and still Eastern. I asked for no rice and the lady listened and the hot sauce is spicy and sweet but not sriracha!  The pickled veggies and the sauted vermicelli were delicious!  My veggie bowl with vermicelli noodles and tofu stir fry came out to less than $10 which is really comparable to Panda Express.
author: R C.

description:
On my usual ventures to Stonestown, I usually decide between Tokyo Express, California Crisp, and Sorabol. Great Steak Escape (or whatever it's called) use to be on the list, but in a half-assed attempt at trying to eat healthier, I rarely go here. And I use to go to Boudin's with my sister, but that tradition went out when my sister stopped working weekends.

Sorabol isn't that bad. I've never really had bad customer service... none that I can remember... and the lines are pretty fast, if you don't have an old person gum it up and try to decide what they want while they're ordering and not letting you go on ahead. Fuckers.

I kinda find it funny that they cut the meat with scissors. I mean, I guess it's sanitary if they only use those scissors for cutting meat and not for cutting out coupons.

The two items I usually get here are the BBQ Chicken rice and noodle bowl or the Spicy Pork rice and noodle bowl. I once got the unagi rice and noodle bowl, since I really love unagi, but that took forever so I only get my eel craving fix at Tokyo Express... or if I'm elsewhere... elsewhere. And with that, I've never found the food to be bad. It's not the best, of course, but it doesn't make me sick.

I still come here when I'm not in the mood for a salad or panini or sushi, so I can't say anything totally bad about this place. It's okay, especially if you want rice and don't go to Panda Express like me.
author: Chris S.

description: I'm on vacation took my mother to the SF Antique Mall got hungry went to Stones town and order a plate of Barbecue chicken with the side of pot sticker. Now the chicken was cold, the pot sticker taste like crap I mean how  hard is it to make pot sticker the noodles were okay and Ladies at Sorabol you should watch who's next instead of skipping me to another customer and one more bit of advice keep the food warm and steam your vegetables.
author: jerry p.

description:
I only ever order the veggie bowl with spicy chicken added. I really think it's much healthier than anything else in the Stonestown food court ! The other good choice would maybe be the soup kitchen.
But I usually go  with some Sorabol. 

Try Sorabol! It's not horrible!
author: Jessica O.

description:
Nothing special here.  The food won't even satisfy in a pinch.  I got the noodle salad (yea, wtf was I thinking?!) and it had the blandest flavor EVER!

The carrots and cabbage made it taste sour - yech!  

The teriyaki chicken was cold and burnt.

The portions were plentiful, but who would want to eat it if it tastes NAST-TAY!!!!
author: Michelle W.

description: Low quality, small quantity (servers are trained to count the strands of noodles and little itty pieces of broccoli and meat); and exceptionally rude service.  If the server puts too much food on the plate, the cashier will take it out and put it back onto the steam table.  The exceptionally rude service is something that one can count on every time.  I work in the mall and the rude service at Sorabol is common knowledge!  Be ready to catch your change when it is thrown at you!
author: Lucky L.

description:
I got the Lunchbox and it was pretty good. The chicken was very tender and tasted GREAT! The rice and noodles that accompanied were tasty, and the roll was delicious. The potstickers were so-so but it was edible.

I also tried the chicken rice bowl. Man that was some good stuff. Big portions that will definately keep you full for a long period of time. You'll feel dead afterwards!
author: Katherine C.

description: really need to improve the food quality.  got ramen...INSTANT RAMEN...YIKES...but the price...oohhhhh.....fish ball noodle...rhhh..bland...i remember the food used to be decent...but i guess not anymore!
author: Pikachu P.

description: Bad food, bad service.  I was given hard dried up pieces of teriyaki chicken....
author: Bobby L.

description: Do Not order the ramen dish from here. $8.00 for instant ramen? Give me a break.
author: sunshine l.

description: Just your average mall food, nothing special. I always like to get their lunch box special with chicken teryaki, mmmm. Decent food, but nothing to excite your palette.
author: Christian C.

description: Ok this is the cheapest Sorabol in the city, not cheap as in low cost but cheap as in they are stingy!! If they give you 2 strands too much of noodle, meat or rice they would literally pick it out of the bowl and put it back in the serving tray. Food is good but damn so stingy with their portions. Learn from the other 2 chains, they give enough to feed 2 people
author: Karen T.

description: I can't give more than three stars for a place where 99% of the menu is contributing to the supersizing of America, but, if you ask, nicely, they might slip you light tofu a la carte for a mere $2. Consider it the Healthy Yelper's secret menu.
author: Jason B.

description: The undercooked pot stickers and the over cooked egg rolls put me off  everything else on the menu... the Japanese place across the food court is a way better option - especially considering they just raised their prices again (Though its unclear if that is due to the holiday season or the bad economy)
author: Quartknee K.

description: This was the first Sorabol I've ever been to. The prices are mediocre but the food preparation is pretty good. I usually get the BBQ chicken with rice, clear noodles, and veggies. I had it most recently last Saturday. For $7.25 + tax, it was on the higher side of mall food court pricing as I was shying away from my saturation of Panda Express over the years. The BBQ chicken is cut with scissors and not even a plastic knife is provided. I guess it just doesn't occur to them that customers will still need it after the 5 second cuts the scissor makes. I wish kimchi was included, it doesn't feel like a Korean meal without it. Food temperature was barely warm and the veggies were pretty solid. I hate mushrooms and the clear noodles just happened to have them. The noodles were much better than before though, I'll give them that.
author: Dominic T.

description: Don't have the Thai tea it's so nasty and watered down plus the potsickers tasted like they'd been sitting out and they just opened
author: Lani R.

description:
i hate this place with a passion!
the people there are so rude!
one day i was waiting for them to take my order (i was the only one in the line)... they ignored me totally and went on with their prepping n stuff... 
then this couple from their stupid church comes and since they're all friends and stuff the sorabol people were being so friendly with them and asked if they wanted some food... bla bla...
i figured i didn't want to waste my money on such a place so i went elsewhere to get my lunch...
'shilmang ida jungmal'
author: charlotte s.

description: Got the lunch box. Because my friend usually gets it and it looks yummy. So this time I went to Stonestown to try this place. The BBQ chicken was flavorless! The veggies were cold! The noodles were good, but way to much soy sauce! Anyways yeah they do have bad customer service! They didn't even tell me the price of my food! Their little dipping sauce was good though.
author: Janet Z.

description:
i never intended to eat here, but given that i'd been curious as to why the lines have been so long at this place, i thought i'd give it a shot. what a terrible choice that was! the chap chae (clear noodles) were a little too greased up with sesame oil and the ribs tasted like brown sugar on a stick. i felt like i was eating an instant, packaged version of korean food =(

but, props on the kimchee. the little cup that they gave me brought a little smile to my face. there is hope.
author: Nicole K.

description: I agree with Nancy P. The ladies here are extremely rude. Especially the older ones. They also are pretty skimpy with their servings. Once I ordered a BBQ chicken plate and I asked the lady to give me an extra serving of rice instead of the veggies. She said OK and turned slightly and just scooped part of the rice that I already had in the container into the part where the veggies were supposed to go. You would think that they would have been happy to replace the veggies being that the rice is a cheaper item. I've been to this place about a dozen times and it's always the same so I just stopped going. They opened a branch in the westfield mall and I haven't gone near it.
author: Diane M.

description: I ate at this Sorabol location for the first time today. I wasn't planning to eat Korean food but when we walked by, the picture of the tofu soup looked so delicious. I couldn't resist so I ordered it and my husband ordered the BBQ chicken. I've got to say, my tofu soup looked nothing like the soup in the picture. It didn't even have an egg in it. I think it was the WORST tofu soup I've ever eaten in my life... and it wasn't even cheap. My husband's BBQ chicken was OK. but it looked like 1/3 of the amount that the Rincon/Westfield mall locations normally give. Overall I was really disappointed because I usually really enjoy the other Sorabol locations. I don't think I will be eating here again.
author: S H.

description: Wow! It's just me and Max K. who like this place? I love everything on their menu! But my favorite is the BBQ chicken bowl--a good sized portion of rice, noodles, chicken, sauce, and veggies! Yum! My sister likes the spicy chicken bowl (which she said is actually spicy) and I will have to try it next time because it smelled sooooo good! It has that Sirachi hot sauce which I love! The times I've been here the staff have been courteous to me.  I'll continue to go back for it's good food and reasonable prices.
author: Mel P.

description: glad to see all the similar reviews!!  skimpy servings, dried out chicken when i ate there last week, sooo stingy with the kim chee, and, yes, when i have come here with my son, they give more rice, etc. to men!!!   they can be rude , too!!!   going to go over to Panda Express next time!!   (the dry, chewy chicken was the last straw)  and not cheap either!!!
author: suzanne e.

description:
kimchi gave this place one extra star. 
kimchi and bbq beef over rice made my day after not going to class. 

the only problem i have ins that ti's overpriced for the amount of food you get.
author: Eric Y.

description:
why does a place touted as a korean restaurant so prominently tout that they sell thai iced tea? who knows?

i'd stop by once a week or so when i was still in high school and working at the mall. word to the wise: leave this food for mall employees who can't go elsewhere during their breaks. 

if you have a car, or working feet, or at least a wheelchair, it's worth going across town to any other korean restaurant. think of this as the panda express of korean food, much like the "olive-garden-ization" of italian.

i mean, really, it isn't bad, but it isn't very good.
author: Charles C.

description: Asked the lady behind the counter for ramen soup (my 4 year old really wanted that).  I didn't have time to read the menu, as I was trying to keep track of my busy 2-year-old.  She said they didn't have that (weird for a Korean restaurant?), and she ended up selling me some veggie soup with egg noodles.  As we are sitting nearby eating the soup, I notice a sign on their counter advertising ramen soup, available in mild or spicy! (grrrr)  When we checked out, the lady behind the counter was asking me if I had a stroller for my 2-year-old (I guess she was concerned that my kid was running around).  I think she ought to be less concerned about that, and a little more familiar with her own establishment's menu.  I was pretty irritated when I read that they did in fact have *exactly* what we wanted to order on the menu!  My four-year-old was very unhappy, because she didn't like the soup the lady sold us (because it wasn't ramen noodles, and also not a very flavorful broth -- it was edible for me, but a would say a bit bland/watery).  Poor customer service!
author: C L.

description: Garbage... Overpriced and skimpy as fuck. The lady was trying to remove two pieces of noodles from so she could save herself two cents. They hide the kim chi so people have to ask for it. Because every kim chi they save saves them three cents. Saved five cents, got one star great business plan!
author: Edward S.

description: One star for the mediocre food and four stars OFF for the RUDE service.
author: Millie N.

description: they should rename their chicken bowl "BURNT ASS CHICKEN BOWL!!!"
author: JUDY L.

description: have i really never reviewed thisplace? def. one of my top choices when looking for some munchmunch at stonestown. I SAY CHICKEN BOWL all the way!
author: M J.

description: Pretty darn good for mall food.  The bowls are a deal and the kimchi soup is super.  If you're in Stonestown and are hungry for some asian food I'd suggest going here then anywhere else.  Much better then that Japanese restaurant across the way.  You'll find nothing but old sweaty fish there, but if you like stomach aches then for it lol.
author: Nobou H.

description: i never ate here, and i dont plan to.  food doesnt look too appealing.  i ate at the one across the bay bridge, sure they give you lot of food, but at what cost? i guess for Koreans, this is our panda express.
author: A L.
